radiographic_examinations.findings: Basilar consolidation in the right lung, small pleural effusion on the right side, increased interstitial markings bilaterally.

Hyperdensities adjacent to the frontal horn of the left lateral ventricle in the vicinity of the caudate head and in the left basal ganglia, suggestive of a small hemorrhagic infarct. Prominent ventricles and sulci.

High T2-weighted signal intensity in a lesion in the left basal ganglia and in a lesion in the left thalamus, diffusion abnormality in the left caudate head, brain atrophy, and small-vessel ischemic changes; no mass effect or midline shift.
Bilateral pleural effusions and basilar atelectasis, no evidence of pulmonary edema.
Enlarged right lobe of the thyroid with low-density nodules, dilated esophagus, air-liquid level in upper thoracic segment, scattered small and slightly enlarged mediastinal lymph nodes.
Dilatation of the left frontal horn and ill-defined area of hyperdensity in the left caudate nucleus suggestive of chronic ischemic changes.
Normal-size kidneys, increased echogenicity, no nephrolithiasis or hydronephrosis.
